prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with a slightly angled top surface and a slightly tapered shape Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5067, 0.0] Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. This sketch will be scaled and then transformed into a 3D sketch. The sketch consists of one face (face\\_1) and multiple loops and curves. Here is an overview of the loops and curves: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.2534, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.2534, 0.0], End Point [0.2483, 0.3064] + Line 3: Start Point [0.2483, 0.3064], End Point [0.5017, 0.3064] + Line 4: Start Point [0.5017, 0.3064], End Point [0.4966, 0.0] + Line 5: Start Point [0.4966, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] + Line 6: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.5017, 0.7184] + Line 7: Start Point [0.5017, 0.7184], End Point [0.2483, 0.7184] + Line 8: Start Point [0.2483, 0.7184], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Please note that each line is connected end-to-end in a closed loop. The total length of this sketch is approximately 0.75 units, and the width is approximately 0.51 units. The height of the sketch is determined by the z-value of the coordinate system. After you have created the 2D sketch, scale it using the sketch\\_scale parameter with a value of 0.75. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5067, 0.0] Finally, extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model. Use an extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal value of 0.5067 units and an extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal value of 0 units. Set the sketch\\_scale value to 0.75 and apply the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" operation. Summary The resulting part is a rectangular prism with a slightly angled top surface and a slightly tapered shape. The length, width, and height of this part are approximately 0.75, 0.51, and 0.51 units, respectively. The part is created as a new body and added to the assembly.</description>
